AssignToNewFrameOfReference.description:
AssignToNewFrameOfReference()
  Method for assigning a new frame-of-reference to the examination. 
              
  Stored dicom data will be updated with the new Frame of Reference 
  UID (0020, 0052), new SOP Instance UIDs (0008, 0018) and a new 
  Series Instance UIDs (0020, 000E). 
  The modified tags will be used if the examination is exported.
              
  Note that if the method is used on an examination which is in the 
  same frame-of-reference as another examination or is in the same 
  frame-of-reference as the to or from frame-of-reference in a 
  FrameOfReferenceRegistration, 
  methods demanding that examinations are in the same 
  frame-of-reference (or has a frame-of-reference registration 
  defined), such as create deformable registraion or compute dose on 
  additional set,
  can not be used until a new frame-of-reference registration 
  between the examinations has been created.
  Can only be used if the examination:
  - has not been used to create a frame-of-reference registration
  - is not referenced in a structure registration (i.e., added rigid 
  transform or deformable registration), 
  - is not part of an examination group,
  - is not referenced by a treatment plan, or
  - does not have computed doses
              
  Patient will be closed and reopened in order to initalize views 
  correctly given the new frame-of-reference

SetImagingSystemReference.description:
SetImagingSystemReference(..)
  Action that sets ImagingSystemReference for the EquipmentInfo of 
  an Examination. 
  If the examination belongs to an 4DCT group, all examinations in 
  the group will be assigned the selected ImagingSystem.
  Only commissioned, nondepricated ImagingSystems can be used.
  If the selected ImagingSystem is a CBCT machine, Modality will be 
  updated to 'CBCT'.
  Parameters:
    ImagingSystemName - The name of the ImagingSystem
      Note: if left empty ImagingSystem will be assigned 'None'. If 
      changing from a CBCT machine, Modality will be updated to 'CT'

SetCtToDensityTableForCbctImage.description:
SetCtToDensityTableForCbctImage(..)
  Action that sets CtToDensityTable for a CBCT image. In parameter 
  is an array with five short ints that correspond to the density 
  thresholds between:
    Air to Lung
    Lung to Adipose
    Adipose to Tissue
    Tissue to Cartilage/Bone
    Cartilage/Bone to Other
  Values within the threshold ranges will be mapped to the following 
  densities:
    Materials.Air             0.00121
    Materials.Lung            0.26
    Materials.Adipose         0.95
    Materials.Tissue          1.05
    Materials.CartilageBone   1.6
    Materials.Other           3.0
  Parameters:
    DensityThresholds -  Density thresholds (in CBCT values) 
      used to create the CT to density table

CopyCtToDensityTableFromAnotherCbctImage.description:
CopyCtToDensityTableFromAnotherCbctImage(..)
  Reuses the CT to density table from another CBCT image. 
  Typically this is done in the dose tracking use case. The CT to 
  density table is created for the first fraction image and then 
  used for all other fraction images.
  Parameters:
    FromExaminationName -  Name of the examination from which 
      to copy the CT to density table

SetImageSpecificCtToDensityTable.description:
SetImageSpecificCtToDensityTable(..)
  Action that sets an image specific CT to density table for an 
  Examination.
  Currently it can only be used for CT images.
  Parameters:
    HU - Array with CT values [in HU]
    Rho - Array with mass density values [in g/cm^3]

GetAffineTransformationParametersGivenCe.description:
GetAffineTransformationParametersGivenCenterOfRotation(..)
  Method for extracting registration parameters in elastix 
  AffineTransformation format.
  Parameters:
    TransformationMatrix - 
    CenterOfRotation -

ExportExaminationAsMetaImage.description:
ExportExaminationAsMetaImage(..)
  Export examination as a meta image file 
  (http://www.itk.org/Wiki/ITK/MetaIO/Documentation).
              
  ObjectType              = Image
  NDims                   = 3
  BinaryData              = True
  BinaryDataByteOrderMSB  = False
  CompressedData          = False
  Offset                  = corner center in x, corner center in y, 
  corner center in z
  ElementSpacing          = voxel size in x, voxel size in y, voxel 
  size in z
  DimSize                 = number of voxels in x, number of voxels 
  in y, number of voxels in z
  ElementNumberOfChannels = 1
  ElementType             = MET_SHORT
  ElementDataFile         = MetaFileName
  Note that meta image file uses mm as unit. Hence Offset and 
  ElementSpacing will be exported in mm.
  This method is for experimental use - use with care.
  Parameters:
    MetaFileName - File name

CropImageStackAndStoreAsNewExamination.description:
CropImageStackAndStoreAsNewExamination(..)
  Crops an image stack based on the bounding box described by 
  parameters MinCorner and MaxCorner. 
  The cropped image stack is stored as a new examination, in the 
  same frame-of-reference and with the same voxel size as the 
  original.
              
  This method is for experimental use - use with care.
  Parameters:
    MinCorner - Min corner of bounding box
    MaxCorner - Max corner of bounding box
  Returns:

GetCtToDensityTableForCbctImage.description:
GetCtToDensityTableForCbctImage()
  Computes automatically the thresholds needed for creating a CT 
  to density table for CBCT and creates the corresponding CT to 
  density table. 
  The CT to density table will be the same as when the 'auto' option 
  is used in the "Create Density Table for CBCT" dialog.
  Example:
    [huArray, rhoArray] = cbct.GetCtToDensityTableForCbctImage()
  Returns:
    Returns a list with two arrays. The first array contains the 
    HU values [Hounsfield units] and the second array the densities 
    [g/cm^3].

GetAcquisitionDataFromDicom.description:
GetAcquisitionDataFromDicom()
  Gets acquisition related DICOM tags for the given examination.
  The return value is a dictionary consisting of four modules:
    'EquipmentModule'
    'StudyModule'
    'SeriesModule'
    'ImageModule'
              
  Example:
    data = examination.GetAcquisitionDataFromDicom()
    data['EquipmentModule']['Manufacturer']           // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag: (0008,0070)
    data['EquipmentModule']['InstitutionName']        // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag: (0008,0080)
    data['EquipmentModule']['DeviceSerialNumber']     // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag: (0018,1000)
    data['EquipmentModule']['StationName']            // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag: (0008,1010)
    data['EquipmentModule']['ManufacturersModelName'] // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag: (0008,1090)
              
    data['StudyModule']['StudyDescription']           // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag: (0008,1030)
    data['StudyModule']['StudyInstanceUID']           // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag: (0020,000D)
    data['StudyModule']['StudyID']                    // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag: (0020,0010)
    data['StudyModule']['StudyDateTime']              // Type: 
  DateTime, DICOM tag: (0008,0020) and (0008,0030)
    data['StudyModule']['AccessionNumber']            // Type: Int, 
  DICOM tag: (0008,0050)
                                                      
    data['SeriesModule']['SeriesDescription']         // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag:(0008,103E)
    data['SeriesModule']['SeriesInstanceUID']         // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag:(0020,000E)
    data['SeriesModule']['ProtocolName']              // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag: (0018,1030)
    data['SeriesModule']['SeriesDateTime']            // Type: 
  DateTime, DICOM tag: (0008,0021) and (0008,0031)
                                                      
    data['ImageModule']['AcquisitionNumber']          // Type: Int, 
  DICOM tag: (0020,0012)
    data['ImageModule']['AcquisitionDateTime']        // Type: 
  DateTime, DICOM tag: (0008,0022) and (0008,0032) (note that the 
  earliest time among the slices is returned)
    data['ImageModule']['ContentDateTime']            // Type: 
  DateTime, DICOM tag: (0008,0023) and (0008,0033) (note that the 
  earliest time among the slices is returned)

SetTreatmentPositionAlignmentRegistratio.description:
SetTreatmentPositionAlignmentRegistration(..)
  Action that sets treatment position alignment registration for a 
  CBCT image to the planning image for the treatment delivery plan.
  The CBCT image will be aligned with respect to the beam isocenter 
  of the beams for the current fraction. 
  Treatment adaptation has to be initialized.
              
  Example 1, Manually entered isocenter, Setup correction included 
  in CBCT isocenter:
  case.Examinations['CBCT 
  4'].SetTreatmentPositionAlignmentRegistration(ManualTPAlignment=True, SetupCorrectionIncludedInCbctIsocenter=True, IsocenterReference="Intrinsic", IntrinsicIsocenter={ 'x': -22.44, 'y': -22.44, 'z': -0.17 }, TreatmentPlanForDelivery=plan) 
  
              
  Example 2, Isocenter from treatment plan, Manually entered couch 
  setup:
  case.Examinations['CBCT 
  4'].SetTreatmentPositionAlignmentRegistration(ManualTPAlignment=True, SetupCorrectionIncludedInCbctIsocenter=False, CouchRotationAngle=358, CouchRotationAxis={ 'x': 0, 'y': -1, 'z': 0 }, CouchTranslation={ 'x': 1, 'y': -1.5, 'z': 0.5 }, IsocenterReference="RtPlan", TreatmentPlanForDelivery=plan)
  
              
  Example 3, Varian OBI imaging system with marker match POIs:
  case.Examinations['CBCT 
  4'].SetTreatmentPositionAlignmentRegistration(ManualTPAlignment=False, SetupCorrectionIncludedInCbctIsocenter=False, CouchRotationAngle=0, CouchRotationAxis={ 'x': 0, 'y': -1, 'z': 0 }, CouchTranslation={ 'x': 0.15, 'y': 0.16, 'z': -0.16 }, IsocenterReference="Intrinsic", IntrinsicIsocenter={ 'x': -23.42, 'y': -24.21, 'z': 0.1 }, TreatmentPlanForDelivery=plan)
  
  Intrisic isocenter is the position of the Aquisition isocenter POI 
  on the CBCT.
  The couch translation is calculated as the Aquisition isocenter 
  POI - Initial match isocenter POI on the CBCT.
  Parameters:
    ManualTPAlignment - Defines if the treatment position 
      alignment information is given manually. (In opposite to if 
      marker match POIs is used, supported only by Varian OBI)
    SetupCorrectionIncludedInCbctIsocenter - Defines if setup 
      correction is included in cbct isocenter information or not. 
      If not, couch rotation angle, couch rotation axis and couch 
      translation need to be defined.
      Otherwise, those parameters should be set to null
    CouchRotationAngle - Setup correction: couch rotation 
      angle [deg]
    CouchRotationAxis - Setup correction: couch rotation axis 
      (in DICOM coordinates). Needs to be of length one. 
      Default from UI is rotation around Post-Ant direction, i.e., 
      {'x': 0, 'y': -1, 'z': 0} when used from scripting (dicom 
      coordinates)
    CouchTranslation - Setup correction: couch translation [cm].
    IsocenterReference - How the coordinate system of the CBCT 
      image is defined. Possible values:
      'Intrinsic'  : Coordinate system for which the isocenter point 
      used during patient setup has the coordinates of the 
      IntrinsicIsocenter
      'RtPlan'     : Coordinate system for which the isocenter point 
      used during patient setup has the coordinates as in the 
      corresponding plan, i.e., the image is pre-aligned with the 
      frame-of-reference used in the plan
    IntrinsicIsocenter - Coordinate corresponding to the 
      isocenter of the CBCT image [cm]
      Required if 'IsocenterReference' is 'Intrinsic'. 
      In case 'IsocenterReference' is 'RtPlan', 'IntrinsicIsocenter' 
      will be set to the (shared) beam isocenter for the radiation 
      set used for the current fraction.
    TreatmentPlanForDelivery - Plan used for treatment delivery

WriteStoredDicomDataSetToFileForVerifica.description:
WriteStoredDicomDataSetToFileForVerification(..)
  Write the stored dicom data for the current examination to a 
  text file.
              
  One image slice is used to collect the requested information.
  Hence, for tags with different values in different slices (SOP 
  Instance UID, Content time, Image Position etc), only one value 
  will be reported.
              
  One level of dicom sequence tags is handled. This means that, 
  e.g., for PET images not all the stored tags are exported.
  Parameters:
    FileName - Name of the file

GetDensityThresholdsForCbctImage.description:
GetDensityThresholdsForCbctImage()
  Computes automatically the thresholds needed for creating a CT 
  to density table for CBCT using the 'auto' option. 
  The thresholds will be the same as when the 'auto' option is used 
  in the "Create Density Table for CBCT" dialog. 
  The thresholds can be used as in parameter to 
  SetCtToDensityTableForCbctImageAction.
  Example:
    densityThresholds = cbct.GetDensityThresholdsForCbctImage()
  Returns:
    Returns a dictionary with threshold names and corresponding 
    CBCT values.

GetStoredDicomTagValueForVerification.description:
GetStoredDicomTagValueForVerification(..)
  Get the stored dicom tag value for verification. Tag is given as 
  group and element in hexadecimal format, 
  i.e., Group=0x0008, Element=0x0008 will give back attribute "Image 
  Type"
              
  Dicom sequence tags are currently not supported.
              
  One image slice is used to collect the requested information.
  Hence, for tags with different values in different slices (SOP 
  Instance UID, Content time, Image Position etc), only one value 
  will be reported.
  Parameters:
    Group - Group (hexadecimal)
    Element - Element (hexadecimal)
  Returns:
    Dictionary with description and value (as a string)

GetImageStackHistogram.description:
GetImageStackHistogram(..)
  Computes an histogram over image intensities, either over the 
  whole image or inside an ROI.
  Note that the ROI relative volumes are not accounted for.
  Parameters:
    BinSize - Size of the bins. If BinSize is set to zero, 
      will generate a histogram with around 300 bins.
    ExcludePixelPadding - If true, pixel padding voxel will be 
      excluded from the histogram
    RoiName - Name of ROI which to compute the histogram 
      inside. If left empty, the whole image will be used
    ConvertCbctValueToHu - For CBCT image, apply CBCT values 
      to HU transformation before computing histogram. Note that a 
      CBCT values to density table needs to be specified.
  Returns:
    A sorted dictionary with bin id (i.e., a short) and its nr 
    of entries

GetIntensityStatistics.description:
GetIntensityStatistics(..)
  Computes statistics for the intensities inside an ROI. The 
  result is returned as a dictionary with statistics type 
  ("Average", "Min", "Max") value and unit.
              
  From python script the values are accessible e.g., through:
  statistics = 
  case.Examinations[0].Series[0].ImageStack.GetIntensityStatistics(RoiName="")
  
  average = statistics["Average"]
  for pair in average:
    print str(pair.Key) + " " + str(pair.Value)
  Parameters:
    RoiName - Name of ROI which to compute the statistics 
      inside. If left empty, the outline ROI will be used.
  Returns:
    The ROI statistic.

RoiSurfaceToSurfaceDistanceBasedOnDT.description:
RoiSurfaceToSurfaceDistanceBasedOnDT(..)
  Measures the distance between the surfaces of two ROI geometries 
  using a distance transform based approach. 
  Each point (/voxel) on the surface of the target roi will be 
  assigned the minimum distance to a point (/voxel) on the surface 
  of the reference roi. 
  Note that the measurements are not symmetric
  A dictionary with average, max and min distances are returned
  Parameters:
    ReferenceRoiName - Name of roi from which surface to 
      compute the distance
    TargetRoiName - Name of roi to which surface to compute 
      the distance
  Returns:
    A dictionary with "Average", "Max", and "Min" distances

OutlineBodyOnCBCT.description:
OutlineBodyOnCBCT(..)
  Creates geometry for the External ROI for a limited 
  field-of-view CBCT examination.
  Parameters:
    ModelExaminationName - The name of the examination that 
      will be used as the model. Typically, the planning CT.
      The External ROI must have geometry defined for this 
      examination.
    ThresholdLevel - The threshold level used to guide an MBS 
      mesh based on the geometry of the External ROI for the 
      model examination. This value should be chosen such that 
      larger values correspond to 
      anatomy in the CBCT examination.
    FieldOfViewRoiName - The name of the field-of-view ROI 
      geometry. This ROI defines the region in which
      MBS adaptation is performed for the MBS mesh based on the 
      external geometry in the model
      examination.

      model (in cm).

      will be used.

ComparisonOfRoiGeometries.description:
ComparisonOfRoiGeometries(..)
   Computes overlap measures between two geometries for comparison.
   
   Dice similarity coefficient/index - DSC (also called Dice's 
  coefficient or Sorensen index): 
             2 | ROIA intersect ROIB | / | ROIA | + | ROIB |
   DSC range between 0 (no overlap) and 1 (complete overlap)
   DSC with reference to:
   Dice, "Measures of the amount of ecologic association between 
  species", Ecology 26:297–302 (1945)
              
   Precision:
            | ROIA intersect ROIB | / | ROIA union ROIB |
   Precision range between 0 (no overlap) and 1 (complete overlap)
   Precision with reference to:
   Udupa et al, "A framework for evaluating image segmentation 
  algorithms", Computerized Medical Imaging and Graphics, 
  30(2):75-87 (2006)
              
   Specificity:
            1 - | ROIB not ROIA | / | ROIA |
   Specificity is 1 for a complete overlap, and otherwise less than 1
   Delineation specificity with reference to:
   Udupa et al, "A framework for evaluating image segmentation 
  algorithms", Computerized Medical Imaging and Graphics, 
  30(2):75-87 (2006)
              
   Sensitivity:
            | ROIA intersect ROIB | / | ROIA |
   Sensitivity range between 0 (no overlap) and 1 (complete overlap)
   Delineation sensitivity with reference to:
   Udupa et al, "A framework for evaluating image segmentation 
  algorithms", Computerized Medical Imaging and Graphics, 
  30(2):75-87 (2006)
              
   Mean distance to agreement (Mean DTA):
   Average distance for the surface of ROIA intersect ROIB to the 
  surface of ROIA union ROIB
   Measured using a distance transform based approach. Each point 
  (/voxel) on the surface of the target roi will be assigned the 
  minimum distance to a point (/voxel) on the surface of the 
  reference roi. 
   Mean DTA is 0 for complete overlap. If no overlap, infinity is 
  assigned.
   Unit is cm.
   Note: If the Mean DTA has not been computed there will be no 
  corresponding entry in the return value.
              
   Max distance to agreement (Max DTA):
   Maximum distance for the surface of ROIA intersect ROIB to the 
  surface of ROIA union ROIB
   Measured using a distance transform based approach. Each point 
  (/voxel) on the surface of the target roi will be assigned the 
  minimum distance to a point (/voxel) on the surface of the 
  reference roi. 
   Max DTA is 0 for complete overlap. If no overlap, infinity is 
  assigned.
   Unit is cm.
   Note: If the Max DTA has not been computed there will be no 
  corresponding entry in the return value.
  Parameters:
    RoiA - The name of the ROI geometry A.
    RoiB - The name of the ROI geometry B.
    ComputeDistanceToAgreementMeasures - Determines if Mean 
      DTA and Max DTA are computed (computation time will increase).
      If set to false, Mean DTA and Max DTA will not have 
      corresponding key/value entries in the return value.

AdaptMeshToGeometryAndStoreAsNewRoi.description:
AdaptMeshToGeometryAndStoreAsNewRoi(..)

  project).
  A geometry which is a triangle mesh ("ModelGeometry") is adapted 
  to another geometry of any shape (RoiGeometry). 
  The adapted triangle mesh is stored as a geometry for a ROI which 
  is created by the method (NewRoi).
  Parameters:

      representation Triangle Mesh) to use as model
    RoiGeometry - Name of RoiGeometry to which the model 
      should be adapted

      triangle mesh

ExportRoiGeometryAsMetaImage.description:
ExportRoiGeometryAsMetaImage(..)
  Export a roi geometry (using its voxel representation) as meta 
  image file (http://www.itk.org/Wiki/ITK/MetaIO/Documentation).
  It is possible to select to get the region out in a format (image 
  size, voxel size) corresponding the examination it is defined on.
  As the voxel representation is used voxels in the exported image 
  will have values between 0 and 255, 
  where 0 correspond to voxels outside the roi geometry, 255 to 
  voxels completely inside the roi geometry, and 1 - 254 to voxels 
  on the boundary of the roi geometry, describing the relative 
  belongingness to the roi geometry.
              
  Note that meta image file uses mm as unit. Hence 
  Offset/Position/Origin and ElementSize/ElementSpacing should be 
  given in mm.
  Parameters:
    MetaFileName - File name
    AsExamination - If true, the number of voxels, voxel size 
      and image corner will be the same as the examination the 
      roigeometry is defined on

SetRepresentation.description:
SetRepresentation(..)
  Primary shape of the roi geometry will (if necessary) be changed 
  to the selected representation. Representation can be:
  - Contours
  - Voxels
  - Triangle mesh
  When changing the primary shape, a conversion between shapes is 
  done which can cause a small loss of data. 
  For more information on the conversion algorithms used and its 
  implications, please see RayStation Reference Manual chapter 
  Volume handling.
              
  Remark that a geometry cannot be converted to a MBS mesh using 
  this method. This can be done from the UI using the Create MBS 
  ROI(s) functionality, selecting "ROI based on contour ROI geometry"
  Parameters:
    Representation - Name of the Representation

   Export a roi geometry (using its voxel representation) as meta 
  image file (http://www.itk.org/Wiki/ITK/MetaIO/Documentation).
   Dimensions are given by parameters VoxelSize, Corner and 
  NumberOfVoxels. 
   Note that the grid settings need to be such that the bounding box 
  of the geometry is covered.
              
   As the voxel representation is used voxels in the exported image 
  will have values between 0 and 255, 
   where 0 correspond to voxels outside the roi geometry, 255 to 
  voxels completely inside the roi geometry, and 1 - 254 to voxels 
  on the boundary of the roi geometry, describing the relative 
  belongingness to the roi geometry.
   
   Note that meta image file uses mm as unit. Hence 
  Offset/Position/Origin and ElementSize/ElementSpacing is given in 
  mm.
  Parameters:
    MetaFileName - File name
    VoxelSize - Voxel size in the exported image
    Corner - Corner for the exported image
    NumberOfVoxels - Number of voxels in the exported image

SetWeightedDose.description:
SetWeightedDose(..)
  Sets the dose to a weighted sum of the 
  fraction doses of the beam sets for a number of plans.
  If the dose distribution is a fraction dose, the plan dose is 
  updated accordingly.
  An exception is thrown if the dose distribution is a composite 
  dose, if the PlanNames array 
  is longer than the Weights array, if the PlanNames array contains 
  a name that does not 
  match any plan name for the current patient, if any of the plans 
  in the PlanNames array 
  contains no beam set or more than one beam set or if any of the 
  plans in the PlanNames array 
  does not have a computed fraction dose.
  Parameters:
    PlanNames - A list of the names of the plans whose 
      fraction doses will be used for the dose sum.
    Weights - A list of the weights of the fraction doses.

CreateArcBeam(..)
  Creates and adds a beam of VMAT type.
  Parameters:
    ArcStopGantryAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.
    ArcRotationDirection - Rotation direction of the gantry.
      * Clockwise
      * CounterClockwise
    Energy - Energy for this beam (MV).
    IsocenterData - Dictionary containing isocenter data. Use 
      help functions to create IsocenterData. 
      Example: IsocenterData = beam_set.GetIsocenterData(Name="Iso 
      1") or IsocenterData = 
      beam_set.CreateDefaultIsocenterData(Position={'x':1, 'y':2, 
      'z':3} )
    Name - Beam name, must be unique.
    Description - Description.
    GantryAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.
    CouchAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.
    CollimatorAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.

DeleteBeam.description:
DeleteBeam(..)
  Deletes a beam from the beam list.
  Parameters:
    BeamName - The name of the beam that shall be deleted.

ComputePerturbedDose.description:
ComputePerturbedDose(..)
  Compute perturbed dose on a beam set.
  Parameters:
    DensityPerturbation - A value of the density perturbation 
      in the present fraction. Must be in the interval -0.5 to 0.5.
      Default value is 0.0.
    IsocenterShift - The shift of the isocenter in the present 
      fraction in the DICOM coordinate system.
      Default value is { 'x': 0.0, 'y': 0.0, 'z': 0.0 }.
    OnlyOneDosePerImageSet - Indicates if only one evaluation 
      dose per image set shall be allowed. 
      Previously computed evaluation doses on the selected 
      examinations will be deleted if this is set to true.
      Default is false.
    AllowGridExpansion - Indicates if expansion of the dose 
      grid is allowed if necessary. Default is true.
    ExaminationNames - The names of the examinations to be 
      used. This is a required property and the number of items
      in this list must equal the number of items in the 
      FractionNumbers property.
    FractionNumbers - The numbers of the fractions for which 
      the dose is to be computed. This is a required property
      and the number of items in this list must equal the number of 
      items in the ExaminationNames property. 
      This property must contain at least one item.
    ComputeBeamDoses - Indicates if beam doses shall be 
      computed. Default is true.

ClearBeams.description:
ClearBeams(..)
  Removes all beams or clear the contents of all beams of a beam 
  set.
  Parameters:
    RemoveBeams - Set to true if all beams should be removed.
      If both RemoveBeams and ClearBeamModifiers are true,
      beams will be removed. If both are false, nothing will be done.
      Default is true.
    ClearBeamModifiers - Set to true if beam contents should 
      be cleared.
      If both RemoveBeams and ClearBeamModifiers are true,
      beams will be removed. If both are false, nothing will be done.
      Default is false.

DeleteDoseSpecificationPoint.description:
DeleteDoseSpecificationPoint(..)
  Action that deletes a dose specification point.
  Parameters:
    Name - Name of the dose specification point to delete.

SortSpots.description:
SortSpots(..)
  Adds a spot
  Parameters:
    MaximumStepLength - The maximum step length allowed to be 
      taken [cm]. Distances above this value will get a penalty of 
      1000.
    UseFixedFirstSpot - True if fixing the first spot when 
      sorting. Default value is false.
    PreferredDirection - The direction which is preferred by 
      the sorting algorithm (X, Y, NoPreference).
    OfflinePenaltyFactor - Distances leaving the 
      PreferredScanDirection are multiplied by the 
      OfflinePenaltyFactor. A factor of 1 gives no penalty.

SetStandardBeamColorVisualization.description:
SetStandardBeamColorVisualization()
  Setting the beam color display type: standard.
